meanings.definition: Having the tip chewed off or broken
meanings.sent1: The premorse pencil had a flat end.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the premorse cookie missing a piece.
meanings.sent3: The premorse sandwich looked like a puzzle missing a piece.
meanings.sent4: The premorse tree branch resembled a broken arm.
meanings.sent5: The premorse flower petal had a torn edge.

meanings.definition: To have the tip chewed off or broken
meanings.sent1: He accidentally premorsed the straw while biting it.
meanings.sent2: The dog premorsed the toy bone in minutes.
meanings.sent3: She premorsed the eraser on purpose to make it flat.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel premorsed the nut to crack it open.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar premorsed the leaf to make a cozy home.
